rationale: Paratya australiensis is widespread in coastal areas along the eastern seaboard of Australia, distributed in Queensland, New South Wales, Victoria and Tasmania (Davie 2002), where it is abundant in numerous locations.  No specific threats were identified to this species, nor its environment and thus the species is considered as Least Concern.
assessor: De Grave, S., Page, T. & Ayhong, S.
